intro: Picris sonchoides var. macrorhiza, commonly known as the large-rooted sicklethistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 60–120 cm, featuring a robust, branched stem covered in grayish hairs. The plant has alternate, heart-shaped leaves that are deeply lobed and covered in fine, white pubescence. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a composite head, with ray florets surrounding tubular flowers. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides, fields, and waste areas.
